quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Here are our final actual costs for this year.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: As you can see, we did pretty well, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes. Yes, I can see... that we did indeed. Why don't you explain this to me like I am an eight-year old.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Alright, well this is the overall budget for this fiscal year along the x-axis...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You can see clearly on this page that we have a surplus of $4300.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: But we have to spend that by the end of the day or it will be deducted from next year's budget.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why don't you explain this to me like I'm five.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Your mommy and daddy give you ten dollars to open up a lemonade stand. So you go out and you buy cups and you buy lemons and you buy sugar. And now you find out that it only costs you nine dollars.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: So you have an extra dollar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: So you can give that dollar back to mommy and daddy, but guess what? Next summer...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: And you ask them for money, they're gonna give you nine dollars. 'Cause that's what they think it costs to run the stand. So what you want to do is spend that dollar on something now, so that your parents think it costs ten dollars to run the lemonade stand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So the dollar's a surplus. This is a surplus.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: We have to spend that $4300 by the end of the day or it'll be deducted from next year's budget.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: We should spend this money on a new copier, which we desperately need.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, break it down in terms of, um... okay, I-I think I'm getting you...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Guess what, everybody? Christmas has come early this year. Oscar, very smartly, has discovered an extra $4300 in the budget. Thank you, Oscar. And I have decided with that money I am going to buy a new, drum roll please... [imitates drum roll] Can anybody guess?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, a new copier! [only Oscar applauds] Unless everybody can agree on something better?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: No, no, please. Please do not do this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes, Michael, new chairs. These chairs are terrible. We were supposed to get new ones last year.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So... we all agree to get new chairs then. Good?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [over indistinct conversation] Good? Yeah, he said good, I'm good...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Now listen, we are a paper company. How can we take pride in our jobs if we have to put our fine paper in this wretched machine?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oscar, no. This is not the time for one of your principled stands.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Pam, you make more copies than anyone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Exactly. That should tell you how terrible the chairs are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Okay, good suggestions. All good suggestions. Uh, let's just decide and agree upon one.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: We should really have the office's air quality tested. We have radon coming from below, we have asbestos in the ceilings. These are silent killers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You are the silent killer. Go back to the annex.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I've talked to Meredith, Stanley and Jim about the chairs. I know they're with me on this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, actually, I'm gonna go with copier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ever since Pam and I started dating, I just feel weird asking her to make copies for me. So, I make my own copies. And that copier sucks. Let me tell you, I-But you know what? Pam and I don't have to agree on everything.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Jim, good for you, standing up to Pam like that.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: So Michael, what do you think?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You have to make the decision.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow, okay. Well... I swallowed all your ideas, I'm going to digest them and see what comes out the other end.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight, I'm a little concerned about some of these directions to Schrute Farms...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I mean, like, "156 paces from the light red mailbox, make a left."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How could it be more clear?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I think Andy makes an excellent point.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: But my biggest concern is that there's only one bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We'll dig a trench. As long as it's downhill from the well, we should be fine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Nana Mimi cannot squat over some trench.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well we're not gonna put out stumps, come on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Let's three-way this little issue, and come to a solution by the time we get to Schrute Farms, how's that for a plan?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We're getting married at Schrute Farms, no matter what. I have looked at twelve venues, I have lost eight deposits, and I have seen Angela naked zero times. I am not losing another deposit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So um, I've been thinking about this whole chair/copier thing...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I really think you should reconsider.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, Pam, I really... hate that copier.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: But I really think you should reconsider.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim. Jim, Jim, Jim. I'm not threatening you. I love you. [whispers] But you should know, you're on very dangerous ground [kisses Jim]. [at normal volume] All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is where you'll have your receiving line. Of course we'll clear out all the livestock and hay and such.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're gonna need to be more specific.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Manure covers up the small of the slaughterhouse.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Do you have to slaughter on our wedding day?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh, Dwight, if we pay extra, could you slaughter the entrees the day before?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: See? That's how you do it! Makin' progress here. [steps in manure, trying to laugh it off] ...Darn! Heh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Remember, you were gonna get a new chair, and you were gonna give your old chair to me. Remember that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't know. I haven't decided yet.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'm just gonna grab some lunch. You wanna come with?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really? Absolutely! Yeah, that would be amazing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Woah, you guys going to lunch?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So, I guess that's how they're gonna play this. It is on. [very serious] It is so on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Look, I really need this new chair. I mean, seriously, how is it possible that in five years I've had two engagement rings, and only one chair?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [laughing uproariously with Michael and Jim] Stop it! Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [through the laughter] Oh, is somebody making fun of me?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: The best. Great friends. Thank you, Michael. [all three are still laughing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ahh... I got you some tiramisu. No hard feelings.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That's cool. [opens the container and smells the tiramisu] Mm, good stuff. [throws it in the garbage]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thank you. [goes to Michael's office and knocks on the door]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, that must've been so fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: it was fun. We had a good time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, have I told you you look really nice today?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, is that a new tie?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um, no, not... no. No, I got it at TJ Maxx, four dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You think that's good? Check out these pants. Nine dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look at the ass. Check out the ass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look at that. [begins dancing] Unh. Unh-unh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah! Oh, so I guess Oscar and Jim were talking your ear off about the new copier.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Here's what I was thinking: everyone sits on a chair every day...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Or even uses the copier every day.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Have you made a decision on the butter sculpture?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. I haven't thought of it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. Cow, goat or sheep. It's not that hard.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I would like cow butter sculpture of a cat.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I want a butter sculpture of a cat!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What is this? All right, we're all on the same team. Is it- [steps in manure] Damn! Why is that in the kitchen?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Pam is making copies and is struggling with the machine] You might want to consider changing teams, because we would-we would love to have you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. I have my copies. [holds up messed up copies]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: And I have my original. [holds up original paper, ripped in half]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Michael, I got you a hot chocolate. I hope that's okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Wait, Michael! Let me open the door for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, well, chivalry is not dead after all. Okay...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello! Good to see you! Good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm! [gives Jim a high five] Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Woo! Yeah. Aw, don't take it away!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So... why don't we try this out, we'll see what would happen. Give it a little test drive, what do you say? You pretend to be Angela's father, you will play Angela, and uh, I will pretend to be you. That way you can see what it looks like when you're up here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [whistling Pachelbel's "Canon in D;" switches to singing then back to whistling]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [to minister] Hello, I'm Angela Martin, and-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He doesn't understand a word you're saying.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Although born just minutes from here, he speaks only German. Closed society. So, now, after the readings by all of your sisters, we will arrive at the vows. So, Konrad... [speaks German to minister; minister begins speaking in German] And away we go. This is a little taste of the ceremony, if you will. He's explaining why we're here, what we're doing here, making introductions, blah blah blah... Then he's gonna have Andy repeat a bunch of stuff. He's gonna ask Andy to produce a ring. I have uh, now just uh... just some twine for our purposes, and you will put the ring on her finger. Yadda yadda, then he's going to ask Andy, uh, if he would like to marry Angela. And you will reply, "I do." [Andy mouths, "I do" silently] And then he's going to ask Angela if she would like to marry Andy, to which you will reply...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And there we go. Okay, and that's just about it. Man and wife.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: Got a call about a problem up here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hank, thank God you're here. The office is at a crossroads.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: So, there's no security problem? You know, I hustled up the stairs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes. I need your sage advice. And everyone, whatever Hank decides, that is the decision. That will resolve this issue. [Hank takes some jellybeans from Pam's jar] Yeah, take as many as you want.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: Thank you. Thank you. You know, it's nice and warm up here.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: So what are we talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Well, we have a surplus. Imagine that your parents give you money for a lemonade stand-

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: I know what a surplus is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, okay. Good. Good. Well, here's the thing. Some people want to use the surplus to buy a new copier. Other people are complaining about the chairs.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: I was just thinking. Let me see a chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Now everyone, bear in mind once again that whatever Hank says goes. He is an impartial third party.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: On the one hand, this copier is very old. You should see some of the new copiers they have. You would not believe what they do.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.line: Now the chairs. The chairs are very weak. Very weak chairs. I could not sit all day in this chair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, get out. Get out.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight, I thought I knew what I wanted. And then, being here with you and the German Mennonite minister... it just all felt right. I made a mistake picking Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know you did. And that's why I have taken care of everything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well Monkey, he's a real minister. And you said, "I do." And I said, "I do." And Andy wasn't signing a receipt; he was signing our marriage certificate as a witness.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It does in the state of Pennsylvania.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Take this thing. [takes off twine ring]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My... It's not my fault you don't understand German; I've been telling you to take it for years!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are we, uh... are we leaving or what? [Mose hits Andy in the head with a deflated ball] Ow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey David- [begins coughing violently] I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm eating tiramisu. Some of the chocolate powder just went down my throat. I'm stopping now.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Is this why you're calling me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, no. No. I'm calling- [coughs again] I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm. I'm calling because, um, we have a stupid budget surplus, and people-everybody wants something different.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: You want me to weigh in on a minor budget issue?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, no, no. I want you to make the decision so I'm not the bad guy.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Well if I were you, I would just return the surplus and take the bonus.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Branch managers who come in under budget get 15% of the savings.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I hate disappointing just one person. And I really hate disappointing everyone. But I love Burlington Coat Factory. You go in there with $645, you are literally a king.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [on the phone] We have that going out Tuesday... Okay? Sure, no, I can... I'll double-check that for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Let me call you right back. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have made my decision. We do not need a new copier. We do not need new chairs. This copier... is... [puts paper on glass and makes a copy, then takes paper from glass] working perfectly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Pam, would you stand up for a sec? [sits in Pam's chair] Hmm. See how relaxed I am? I like this chair. [slowly sinking into the chair] Offers good support, it is urkelnomically correct... it's a good chair. I think we're spoiled because we don't appreciate the things that we have. You think kids in Africa have chairs? No. They sit in big piles of garbage. You think they have copiers?  [the chair has slowly lowered itself almost to where Michael is not visible over the desk] They don't have copiers. They don't even- [struggles to get up from Pam's chair] Gah! They don't even have paper. And we are spoiled because we throw out perfectly good tiramisu because it has a little tiny hair on it. My point I this: I have seen the light in terms of what we need, and it is nothing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Does anyone happen to know what 15% of 4300 is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because that is how my mind works.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What's 15% of 200? [Michael doesn't answer] Thank you. Everyone, Michael is returning the surplus so he can keep 15% as a bonus.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You're gonna give yourself a bonus of $645 instead of getting the entire office something it really needs?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't need $645; I already have $645, more or less.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You're gonna get us a copier then?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This is so, so stupid. And, God... [looks at his watch] that's my phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I don't-this doesn't change anything. I have a very important decision to make. We need a new copier. We need new chairs. And I need to figure out a way to keep this money without having everybody hate me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey Tuna, check it out. Tuna sandwich. Just like you. [Angela walks over to Andy] What-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [kisses Andy passionately in his chair] Now, I have to take care of a legal issue.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael, you have to make a decision. The day is almost done.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Let me just say, you've been promising me this chair since the day you hired me.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You are a smart guy. I know you'll do the right thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [groans in frustration] You think it's easy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, you know what? Why don't you guys deal with it? I am going to get up, and I am going to be out in the common area. But you need to decide; otherwise I'm taking the bonus. All right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It is a classic management tactic. You have two sides, a deadline, you know that neither of them are gonna concede. What you do is you put 'em in a room, and you just- [Pam and Oscar come to the door of kitchen] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Hey, we're going with the chairs.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I just figured I'd rather have new chairs than nothing at all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Good work. I'm proud of you. [Pam and Oscar leave] Mother-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [wearing a fur coat] What did we learn this week? Well, one, thanks to me, my team is much, much faster at coming to decisions than I thought they would be. Number two, never buy a fur coat with a credit card until you absolutely have the money to pay for it. And three, [camera zooms out to see fake blood is splattered on the fur coat] you should know that some people think it's cool to throw buckets of fake blood on you as you are walking out of Burlington Coat Factory.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I guess, since I won.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah, you did win. You did win. Anyway, I'm going to need three copies of each of these, stapled and collated. [begins to walk away, then turns back] Totally kidding. [leans in, whispers] I'm gonna need four. [kisses Pam]
